verses.roman:
pathe yāite kare prabhu ucca saṅkīrtana
madhura kaṇṭha-dhvani śuni' āise mṛgī-gaṇa

synonyms: pathe yāite—while passing on the path; kare—does; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ucca—loud; saṅkīrtana—chanting of Hare Kṛṣṇa; madhura—sweet; kaṇṭha-dhvani—the voice from His throat; śuni'-hearing; āise—came; mṛgī-gaṇa—she-deer.
translation: Sometimes Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu chanted very loudly while passing through the jungle. Hearing His sweet voice, all the does came near Him.
